Title:
The Olive Goblet, a new species of stalked cup (Peziza,
Pezizaceae) growing underwater in Oregon: Peziza olivia sp. nov.
Keywords:
underwater cup, taxonomy, diversity, survey and
monitor
Abstract:
The historically polyphyletic genus Peziza sensu lato,
encompassing sporocarp morphologies from sessile cups to stalked
goblets, inrolled and convoluted cups, even hypogeous truffles, has been
reduced to the core group of Peziza sensu strictu around P. vesiculosa,
the type species. A new species, Peziza olivia (Pezizaceae, Peziza sensu
stricto) is described from stream habitats in the Oregon Cascade
Mountains (USA). This new ascomycete grows underwater on sticks and
decomposing wood, and also near to running water, where the woody
substrate is functionally saturated. This report continues a pattern of
documenting new diversity in high quality forest habitats, and provides
data toward monitoring and maintaining these habitats through adaptive
management methods.
